climbs.name: Wrinkle
climbs.fa: Mike Kurilich, Mark Sargent, Peter Campbell July 2009

content.description: Just above the anchor on Midlife Cracksis you will see a finger crack going straight up for about 25 feet. Climb this placing pro until you can link up with the upper part of Grrr-Amp.
content.protection: Small to medium pro up to #2 camalot

content.description:
Climb up a short bit to a flat, horizontal shelf below the right edge of the prominent block.

Using the crack between the block and face, climb up on steep terrain.

Continue up eventually transitioning past the block to the arete which is followed up until near the top where a traverse to the left leads to the anchor atop Grrr Amp.

Engaging climbing with good pro.  Get a few good pieces before committing off the horizontal shelf (and have an attentive belayer).
content.protection: Mix of cams and nuts from .2 to 2".  Doubles on a 2 camalot (or equivalent) might prove useful.
content.location:
On the right side of the block with Grrr Amp to the left.

Right side of Climber's Choice face.

Redrum well to the right.

climbs.name: Phatt Ass
climbs.fa: Mark Sargent, Mike Kurilich, Phil Baldwin July 2009

content.description: 5.8/5.9 Start is just  right  of the large right facing corner. Ascend the crack rising in an upward right traverse, using funky cross-thru lieback moves clipping 7 grey bolts. Pretty cool and unique climbing. More experienced climbers may be able to miss out on some bolts by making semi-blind pro placements at their feet as they layback; just realize the crack flairs in places and the traversing nature of the lower crack combined with the ground upsloping has you at groundfall potential longer than other cracks of this length. However you do it - its a climbers choice. Continue up thru the left side of a crack/break placing either a medium stopper or tech friend and then up left for 5 more bolts to anchor. 12 bolts total. 20 meters
content.protection: Depending how you approach the lead. Either clip bolts and maybe one medium stopper placement or more experienced leaders could place small/medium cams and small wires. More experienced climbers may be able to miss out on some bolts by making semi-blind pro placements at their feet as they layback; just realize the crack flairs in places and the traversing nature of the lower crack combined with the ground upsloping has you at groundfall potential longer than other cracks of this length. However you do it - its a climbers choice.

content.description: There are several starts to this particular climb all about the same grade. 1) Either start up the short crack at the small pine tree to the first tan bolt or 2) 10 feet upslope from the crack traverse over left to the same first tan bolt. Regardless of the start you now climb up, possibly placing a small/medium C4 before reaching a second tan bolt, traverse right then up the face close the right edge clipping 6 bolts along the way. At the last bolt go straight up for the spice or escape out right to the casualness.  Clamber up a vegetated shelve to the anchor. 8 bolts total. 20 meters
content.protection: Draws and maybe a small/medium C4.

climbs.name: Grrr-Amp
climbs.fa: Mike Kurilich, Mark Sargent, Phil Baldwin July 2009

content.description: Start is about 10 meters upslope from Midlife Cracksis. This climb is a mix of gear and bolts. Bring small to large nuts with matching tech friends. The climb starts in a small alcove/notch; climb up the left side of the smooth, right leaning, vertical  table block. Continue up crack to bolt where upper & lower body stemming gets you by the crux. Follow remaining 6 bolts to an anchor. 25 meters
content.protection: Bring small to large nuts with matching tech friends.
content.location: Start is about 10 meters upslope from Midlife Cracksis.

climbs.name: Flat Line
climbs.fa: Mark Sargent, Mike Kurilich, Phil Baldwin July 2009

content.description: Start on Phatt Ass. After the fourth grey bolt go left then up on the 5 rust colored bolts. You may want a few small stoppers for the last 10 feet. End at same anchor as Phatt Ass. 20 meters
content.protection: draws and a few small nuts for top 10 feet
content.location: Start on Phatt Ass. After the fourth grey bolt go left then up on the 5 rust colored bolts.
